Reviews.Title: “Worth paying more to avoid the Brunel”
Reviews.Author: sussexblogger
Reviews.Content: Friends had stayed here and they recommended the location. But when we arrived the room was grubby and the staff curt. Strange how this hotel is always offering deals???? because it has to. For the money I would rather have paid another £30 for a comfortable clean night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic and good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HappiestGirl80
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel twice and was quite pleased with it. it is located in a very good area, very close to an underground station (Paddington), which is one of the most important things for me, when searching for a hotel. i have to be honest and say that i didn't expect a 5 star hotel when paying a low price, and this hotel is very affordable (another important thing). all i wanted was a good location and a clean room to bath and sleep in, and that's exactly what i've got. the staff is very nice, the rooms are small but comfortable and clean, and the breakfast was not bad at all. all in all - i would definitely return to this hotel, as i already did.

Reviews.Title: “small, but thankful for the booking”
Reviews.Author: travellerk02
Reviews.Content: we ended up needing to stay in london for an extra night, and had to make a booking just so we could get 5 more hours sleep. no other hotel could take us, so we walked along paddington until we found the brunel hotel. the woman on reception was so fantastic and welcoming, it was wonderful. the room was very small, and the guests around us were very noisy, however were grateful for the room so all was good. you get what you paid for here...

Reviews.Title: “Location makes it worth it”
Reviews.Author: Nebraska40
Reviews.Content: Small but clean. Hairdryer didn't work couldn't get a new one. Wake up calls missed! Elevator not to the 4th floor.breakfast area and staff was great. location was great near tube and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: BoliviaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: The double room was so tiny we had to store one backpack on top of the cupboard in order to be able to move - the other we placed under the desk. The cupboard could only be opened 20 cm. The carpet looked like something from World War II - very dirty. The window could not hold open - we had to put the only chair in the room in between the bars to hold it. The bathroom was ok, though, and the towels and sheets were clean. The breakfast was very good - order tea, not coffee, since the coffee was always cold.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pyranea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few steps away from Hyde park and from Paddington making it a good location. The hotel is basic. I only stayed there once and had a room in the basement. I could clearly hear the underground passing near by... so avoid the basement !

Reviews.Title: “Only a great location”
Reviews.Author: Plebeya
Reviews.Content: I must say I stayed for one night only. We needed a hotel in Central London, easy to access from Heathrow airport. I agree with all the bad reviews, but donÂ´t forget that you are in London. You are supposed to sleep in a shoebox. We took the Heathrow Express from the airport, and the Paddington station is just 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Make sure you exit on Praed St, then turn right. The hotel entrance is just 5 blocks from there. How great is that? The down side is that the room is tiny and the breakfast poor. But I never expect a resort when IÂ´m in London. Unfortunately, there is no safe in the room. I think thatÂ´s a must

Reviews.Title: “We wont be back!”
Reviews.Author: goonerjools
Reviews.Content: We were 2 female friends on a weekend break. We had read the negative reports about this hotel but could find nothing else for the two days we wanted and so booked and decided to keep an open mind. The location cannot be faulted and from the outside the hotel looks just fine, but our room was like a shoebox, old and very shabby. Peeling paint, one plug that could not be used as it was so close to the table top. The bathroom was tiny,dark and had cracked floor tiles that moved when you walked on them. When we turned the shower on there was a small trickle coming from the shower head, it looked as thought it was blocked with limescale. As we were only staying one more night we stuck it out but just wanted to inform potential guests that the awful reviews on here are very right! On our final morning we paid Â£2.50 more for a full english breakfast, the sausages and tomato were rock solid, and the bacon was some sort of processed meat that was shaped like but certainly not bacon. Before we had drunk our tea the staff were vaccum cleaning the floor around our feet! We have stayed in many London hotels and this was just appalling.

Reviews.Title: “basic but good!”
Reviews.Author: rochibg
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about the reviews, but the hotel had a great location, great breakfast (very complete), great service and very clean. The room was very tiny, but if you plan to spend the whole day out, that is not a problem. Also our room was next to the elevator, and at morning we could hear the lift go up and down, but as we were up early and the noises usually begun while we were dressing up, we didnt care enough about that. Dont recommend if you like nightlife because the rooms are very luminous during day (so if you want to get up late, you wont be able to continue sleeping with the sun coming in).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all Costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrGRW
Reviews.Content: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! We had planned to stay 4 nights at this Hotel or should I say Hovel! The rooms were extremely small, the bathrooms dirty and the staff unhelpful to say the least. Air conditioned rooms, no - the windows would not close and the noise was terrible. The doors looked as though they had been broken into and seemed unsafe. When we asked to be moved, they said they were full and could do nothing. We did something - we moved to another Hotel. I would never use this place if it were the only place in London.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: mojo50_60
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on this hotel prior to going on our Theatre trip and was a little worried as they weren't the best. We were given a room on the third floor and we were very pleased when we walked into the room, it was clean, warm, tidy and very comfortable. We each has a double bed and it was very roomy. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never-ever for leisure, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Loraq
Reviews.Content: The room situated on the -1 floor. Fire-alarm at 6 o'clock in the morning (i was supposed to get up at 8 both of the days) - and the alarm was set only on the basement floor. Horrible service (receptionists ought to be replaced). I cannot complaint about the location - it's really good. But everything else - it's just not worth the money you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Last Resort”
Reviews.Author: ty_of_perth
Reviews.Content: We had to book two rooms for the last days of an overseas trip, and wanted the hotel to be close to Paddington due to the lateness of the hour when we arrived from the Heathrow Express.. The Brunel Hotel seemed to fit the bill, and their web advertising seemed reasonable, as did the price charged through a wholesaler. When we arrived, the check in was handled very efficiently, and with a smile. When we saw our room, we were amazed that they could sell the room as a double. The bed was hard up in a corner, against both walls. It only had a small volume of space left for your luggage on one side.. Once you place your baggage on the floor (there was no other spot to do it) then all floor space was taken up. The room size was the size of a closet, not a true double. It was claustrophobic, but clean. The breakfast bar was clean and run efficiently, In short, if they had proper sized rooms, then we could then consider it in a more positive light, but having the size they do, we warn everyone staying there.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY THERE AT ANY COST”
Reviews.Author: willusa046
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not an hotel but an hostel. Rooms are extremely old fashioned and dirty. The staff are rude and the lift is not safe. The only ok point is the location.

Reviews.Title: “A total disappointment from check-in”
Reviews.Author: MsM123
Reviews.Content: I was very very disappointed with this hotel. While it is in an ideal location; close to the Paddington station, Hyde Park and within walking distance of Oxford street, unfortunately these things did not balance out the service, the room and the overall quality of the hotel. Upon arrival the lift broke down on the way to the third floor with an elderly family member trapped inside. When the alarm bell was activated the staff did nothing to acknowledge the faulty lift and had to be physically alerted at reception, where they would not even offer an apology. The room was disgraceful and very small, it definitely was not large enough to accommodate 3 adults (as requested), and about 30 degrees with no fan offered, the windows unable to be opened and no air conditioning. The bathroom was barely large enough to shower in, the bed covers appeared to be soiled and when attempting to sleep all we heard was an irate neighbour yelling for about 4 hours during the night. When we took all these issues up with reception the following day we were told that they could 'maybe' move us to the basement where there was air conditioning. We declined this offer and alerted the staff that we would be seeking accommodation elsewhere to which we received the reply 'you haven't given us 24 hours notice so you will lose your payment'. When we finally worked out an agreement (we gave them 24 hours notice that we would be checking out the next day, were unhappy with the overall service and would like a fan in our room), we still had to chase up the fan with reception no less than 3 times. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “comfort, economy and location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: joy87
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quiet, clean, comfortable, with excellent, friendly staff and generous continental breakfast. Being just minutes from Kensington Gardens, it's convenient to that gorgeous park, and a good walker can continue through the equally beautiful and tranquill Hyde Park and Green Park to such destinations as the West End, South Bank, Buckingham Palace, Victoria and Albert Museum and many other attractions. It's also minutes from Paddington Station, and from the Central and District and Circle underground lines. Rooms are compact, but efficiently arranged, with private bathrooms, 7 channels on tv. I've stayed for long periods over several years and always found the same dependable and aggreeable accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “brunel hotel london”
Reviews.Author: bot37
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 2 nights in a basement room i found the staff very helpful the room was lovely and clean and big enough for 2 of us, room toilet was a little small but clean. At breakfast staff very nice helpful, would stay there again very central to everything in London

Reviews.Title: “Not again in this lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: BobbySmith7
Reviews.Content: First of all the address is misleading. The Hotel is NOT on Gloucester Terrace. It is on Craven. We walked from Paddington Station with our bags and couldn't find the hotel until we asked a taxi driver. Whlie the lobby is very nice (and air conditioned) the room was VERY small, VERY hot, and VERY much not worth the money. It was the most expensive room in which I stayed over my week's visit to Great Britain and was least worth the money. Although we had intended to pay cash everywhere we stayed (and did everywhere else), the Brunel took the liberty of charging the credit card with which I had secured the reservation via an online booking service for the first night of our stay before I arrived. WiFi was 5 pounds per day. Use of a computer was 2 pounds per half hour. There were 4 (sometimes 5) channels from which to choose on the small, outdated television set. The best thing about the staff was that they ignored you unless questioned directly

Reviews.Title: “SMALL,CRAMPED,TIRED---NOT 3 STARS”
Reviews.Author: IrishGypsy2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three days July 3 to 6th..first off when making reservations told hotel we would be traveling with someone who had a walking ailment was assured that there would be a lift avail..upon check in we were given a fourth floor flat...the lift stopped at the third floor...since hotel is a converted townhouse the steps were hard to navigate with a suitcase without the issue of having an ailment that impedes walking...the room was very small the fan provided did not work..the bath was so small we had to take turns stepping out of the room to give the other person privacy to dress as there was no room in the "closet size" bathroom to change clothes...we were told we could not have more than one key which made it difficult since not all of us were doing the same activites while in London...maybe in London this is considered 3stars if so I am glad we spent the better part of our vacation in Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but nice, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: MiguelNAntunes
Reviews.Content: Basic, but very nice. Good location ( 4 min walk from Paddington or Lancaster Gate Tube Station). Clean room, confortable beds. Excelente continental breakfust. Friendly and helpful staff. Ideal for those who want a nice room to stay and save money to spend it on this funtastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth to check in”
Reviews.Author: SouthGER_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked a double bedroom for 3 nights via a hotel booking portal 7 months in advance to arrival date and received one of the last available rooms at our late night arrival we gave advance note of. The room can be describe as a lumber-room only enough room to put a "double bed" (approx 1.40 x 1.80m size) in it, nearly no space left to move. The bed has been in an absolutly disasterous condition (way too small for two adults, a totally worn-out mattress), so we had 3 awful nights for 184 GBP in total (approx. 290 US-$ or 197 EURO). At least the hotel was located close to public transport and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Gloucester Terrace”
Reviews.Author: JTR89
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was more interested in reading her newspaper than checking me in. The rooms were advertised as non-smoking but the smoke smell was awful once I got to my basement room which, by the way, was way below standard of how the representitive room appeared on the website. I had safety concerns with being in the basement as well. Due to health concerns I had to check out of the hotel immediately.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER EVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DazNao
Reviews.Content: As a young couple we decided to stay here even after reading the lousey reviews from other guests as we thought we wasn't too picky - as long as we had a bed to sleep in for the three nights that we intended to stay. After all - we intended to go out for the full days and evenings to make the most of our time in London- WHAT A MISTAKE! Upon arrival all seemed okay. The recpetionist was polite and gave us our room card key- they even let us check in a little earlier than 2pm free of charge. However our first good impressions were soon shattered as we entered bedroom number 101. Upon enetering the room- the room was tiny, just enough space to walk around the bed, with the tiniest and smelliest wardrobe ever. We decided that yes it wasn't great but it would do for the few nights that we intended to stay in London as we were only using the room to sleep. We headed out to London. We returned to go to bed around 10pm so we was fresh for the next day. However .......once settled and ready to sleep, the sound of the underground subway was horrendous, every five minutes the whole room vibrated!This continued until 12:30am, and started again at 5:30am! As you can guess we did not stay another night and transferred to another hotel the next morning as this would have spoilt our stay. Do not go to this hotel. We were absolutely disgusted! Darren and Naomi, Nottinghamshire.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value we made a good choice”
Reviews.Author: GROUTAGE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights, we just needed a base somewhere clean to wash and sleep and we were on a tight budget, so this hotel was perfect for us. The hotel was within walking distanc from Paddington station and central line underground. There is a 24 hour desk staff on duty who are very friendly and helpful, and there is a good continental breakfast or for a small charge a full english is avalable BUT unfortunately the staff in the breakfast room are not at all friendly but heigh we wern't there to see them. The room is rather small but has all you need for a base. Tea/coffee, t.v, hair dryer, all rooms are en-suite and the towels are changed daily and the room is also cleaned daily. In all excellent value for money and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good,basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobbyEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in this hotel. The hotel was an easy,level walk less than 10 minutes from Paddington Station .Our room was small and pretty basic but also clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was good and there was plenty of it for Â£5. We didn't try the full english breakfast but it looked good. There's a small room to leave bags if you don't want to drag them around with you after you check out. While we were staying at the hotel we went to a concert at Wembley Stadium and used Brevet cab company based in Wembley to take us back to the hotel. They provided an excellent service even phoning us after the gig to make sure we could find our way to the pick-up point.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: KarenLeeds
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through agent for a twin room and email confirmation confirmed type of room and booking. Rang Hotel week prior to arrival to check if I could store my case at midday to which I was told yes no problem and they informed me that the booking was for a double room. I corrected them and confirmed no it was for a twin room - no problem they said, we will change room type and ensure you have a twin room. Upon arriving at hotel I was told again the booking was for a double room and had to correct them again to which they confirmed it would not be a problem and they would change it to a twin room. Went off shopping and returned at 7.00 pm to be given a key to a twin room. Upon entering the room it was already occupied by other guests. The hotel had messed up and only had a double room available. We argued till we were blue in the face and also tried to book somewhere else but all hotels were fully booked with it being Wimbledon. We had no option but to accept the double room for the first night which was so small, stuffy, smelt and noisey. Second day we were moved to twin room but upon returning to the room in the evening after a day long work conference we entered the lift which then stuck between floors - so frightening. We were released quite quickly from the lift and went to bed. At 3.00 am someone set off the fire alarm and so we had to stand in our night clothes on the street for 40 mins. Never again will I stay in this hotel. The only reasonable aspect was the breakfast restaurant and food which was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: lipglosswoo
Reviews.Content: Two Friends and I stayed at this hotel in the febuary half term, as it was cheap and had a tripple room.When We arrived at this hotel I was told i could not pay by Cash and card had to pay by one or the other. We were then given a room on the 1st floor which was absoultly digusting a funny smell in the bathroom ( which was tiny) and in the wardrobe. Costomer service was decent was given a new room on the 4th floor which to be frank was too small for 3 people although was much cleaner but also hotter and the lift wasnt working.. which isint great for 3 girls carrying alot of shoes.Â  I will never return to that awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “standards have slipped”
Reviews.Author: jefdow
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 5 times over the past 10 years and have seen the standards of this place gradually slipping. Went down last year for the Springsteen concert and was very dissappointed in this hotel. It's ok if you just want somewhere to sleep,it's in a decent area....down the road from Paddington station and round the corner from Hyde park. If this place has a complete makeover I would definitely stay here again, but until then...

Reviews.Title: “At least it was pretty cheap...”
Reviews.Author: captaineyeballs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on the 28th of January 2009 with my wife because it is close to Paddington station, and it was the cheapest on offer. We were returning from Bangkok and had not slept for the best part of 28 hours. Imagine my delight when the chap manning reception left us waiting aimlessly in the foyer for 5 minutes while he finished his cigarette outside the front door, ignoring us and chatting to his mate. If it weren't for the fact I was only forking out 40 quid for the stay, I'd have left there and then. I don't need to be given a red carpet to walk on, but I do rather expect to be given priority over a cigarette when I'm checking in. What classy service; not the best first impression. The room itself was actually not the smallest I've suffered in London, and was fortunately only on the 2nd floor since the lifts were not working. The double bed however was two single beds I am guessing were never intended to be joined, since they began with a large and prominent lump the length of the centre beneath the thin sheet, and then gradually moved away from each other as the night wore on, leaving me wedged in a somewhat undignified fashion in the developing gap... The bathroom was disgusting. The floor tiles were pretty filthy and streaked black around the toilet and the shower was hideous. Strange clumps of miscellaneous grot clung to the edges of the shower tray. The plug was blocked and didn't even pretend to drain, at all. However, the TV worked fine and the window opened. The electronic lock worked first time on the door (amazing!) and there was tea and coffee in the room. It was warm and for 40 quid in central London, I am not too bothered about the rude staff and the grim bathroom. I have stayed in much worse places, although they have all been in the third world.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel will def book again”
Reviews.Author: daintym
Reviews.Content: To be honest when i booked the hotl and ead these reviews was going to cancel but i decided to go for it . well i was very surpised , hotel is clean staff is very feindly they do have a conversation and they did help with luggages they even gave us extra time in room after checking out time . what can you expect more from budget hotel room s and towels were everyday done , breakfast was not big however this is not a 5 star so it s more than enough as for the noise , you do hear some underground noises but let be true how much time is spent in hotel during the day ? underground close at night so maybe an hour you hear just a small noice two tubes are close to hotel so what could one need more , i would recommed if its a small short break in busy london ;)

Reviews.Title: “Shocking... Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: The_GuardianLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotels.com are advertising this hotel as a 3-star. When I checked in, the staff decided to try to get me to pay for my stay again having already pre-paid. This started a stand-up row during which I asked them whether they had ever heard of customer service or the phrase "the customer is King". They told me that it "very much depends on the customer" and clearly considered me to be out of order for not simply paying twice. After I pointed out that I actually live in the area and would not be on the next plane to somewhere far away like the majority of their guests, they finally calmed down enough to let me check in. They have me Room 101. Literally. The room was DISGUSTING. It was tiny and smelled like something had died under the bed. There were dubious stains on the tissue box and others on the chipped woodwork next to the bed. This week Christopher Rodrigues, chairman of VisitBritain, warned that 50,000 jobs could be lost this year in the hotel industry. This hotel should be the first to go if there is any justice in the world.

Reviews.Title: “VERY noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Teriso
Reviews.Content: Actually I should have stood at a different hotel of the Crystal series but they had to relocate me "because of maintenance problems". They arranged a taxi transfer to Brunel hotel where I was given a tiny room in the basement. I could hear the underground trains going by every 2-5 minutes so clearly as if a station was next to my room. The kettle turned on randomly (without water!) for some split-seconds, making loud clicking sounds. To make things worse the room was right opposite the breakfast room (~ 6-7 m from bed to breakfast table!) so starting from 7 am constant coming and going. This was definitely the worst stay I ever had. I recommend not accepting any rooms in the basement at all if you have to stay here. Breakfast was very basic, there are lots of restaurants really close that offer much more value for the money, not talking about the atmosphere of a window-less basement breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: ellieNewcastle
Reviews.Content: after reading some slightly dubious reviews of this hotel, i really wasn't looking forward to staying! however, it wasn't as bad as i thought it would be. yes, the room was very basic (and had a rather odd smell...) and the bathroom was the tiniest room i have ever been in! also, the staff weren't the friendliest bunch...but on the other hand, the hotel is in a really great location (lots of shops and places to eat nearby and paddington tube station a 2 min walk) and its fine if you won't be spending much time there. however, i dont think that i would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Average Room for a reasonbale price”
Reviews.Author: tigerJB
Reviews.Content: Booked through lateroom as I was staying in London for work and had stayed in the area at the Best Western Paddington Court the week previous. I was expecting a total hole after reading the reports on this site however after checking in and getting to my room I was pleasently suprised. The room was on the 3rd floor, it was light, airey, and there was enough space. The bathroom was small, however I paid Â£55 per night so I was not expecting a suite. You do get the tube vibrations up until about 11.30pm and from about 6am but its not something that kept me up. If your looking for budget accomodation in Bayswater its worth a look, the local eateries are also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly disgusting not fit to be called a hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lordcowell
Reviews.Content: We actually booked in to this hotel and left after we had gone for dinner and located somewhere decent. It was absolutely gross! The room was the size of our utility cupboard at home, and very smelly. In fact it smelt of poo very badly and the entrance to it smelt of tcp. The bed was tiny, and the mattress filthy. The walls were very dirty, and burnt above the light fitting. The bathroom scared me, and I didn't want to even go in there, but upon inspection it was dirty, cramped and the stink was unbeliveable. Do not stay there!!!! Not fit for my cats, let alone humans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever In The World!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nadinePreston
Reviews.Content: Please everyone stay away from this hotel if people stop going they will have to shut down!!! I stayed at this hotel over the easter weekend with my daughter aged 8 and my mum and dad, thank goodness i never brought my baby as i would of left as soon as i arrived!!! Firstly the room we stayed which should of been for my self and 2 children was smaller than my box room you literally had to climb over the bed to move, this is where i booked also for my baby although there was no cot and no room for a cot when i asked reception about this there answer was well we never charged you for the baby!!!! although it did cost us Â£400 for 2 nights i also asked for my room to be changed as i was not happy in fact i felt like crying as it felt like i had walked back into the 80s not only that it was filthy and you had to shut the bathroom door to be able to move in the bathroom which was like a cupboard!!!! they said they could not change the room and could not reimburse our money, so my dad furious at this point asked to see the manager to be told he would not be in till monday our day of departure, had my daughter not been with us we would of left but she was so excited to see the sights of london we stayed, all i can say is i am still itching 4 days later from sleeping in the beds, the breakfast was the worst breakfast i have ever tasted all warmed straight from the fridge so on the second day we went out for breakfast!!! DISGUSTING HOW IN THIS DAY AND AGE IN THE CAPITAL OF THE UK PLACES LIKE THIS CAN STILL BE IN BUSINESS!!!!! MY ADVICE STAY WELL AWAY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warning to business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Business_travell0r
Reviews.Content: Do be honest to get a hotel for Â£50 in London what are you going to really expect? So maybe need to take comments with a pinch of salt. Lift very very small and really only fits one person. Door room card key took four attempts with me running up and down the stairs to get it re-coded. Finally the receptionist had to come up and use another card. Rooms very small (small for even London standards) Generally maintance and cleanliness very poor. Random items left on stairs, Doors propped open with fire extinguishers. Room condition just as bad. Toilet bowl stained water did not drain out of sink, shower head provided but no where to hang it on the wall. Water pressue very low so I doubt shower would have worked anyway. Bed mattress very used and bumpy and not sure if any creppy crawley in the bed as well so tried to sleep on top of the covers. Personally on the night I stayed found outside noise interupted sleep which ended up being approx 2 hrs as hotel noise started 5.30 am A College of mine was in another room which he had to move ot of during the night as he heard something scratching under the bed. Generally I do try and give a fair and balance views but on this occasion I would not ever go there again or recommend. If there had to be anything positive at all the only thing is its location near to Paddington. My advise ensure you read Trip Advisor before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Martin123Prague
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist and don't want to spend your time in a hotel room this is a place for you. Room was very very small (just bed and a small table) and so bathroom with the shower, but it was clear. What is the best about this hotel is the location. It is just 100m from Paddington station on the Circle line which can take you to all the sights in London and there is also the first bus stop of many bus lines so you are the only passenger on the stop and you can take a place right in front of the upper window and have a sightseening tour nearly for free. Yes, it is a little bit noisy place because the hotel stands on the crossroad and above the tube line (so you can hear it while passing under :) but it is not so bed. I think it is a good offer for that money. And if you just want to have a bed and breakfast it is a great place to stay over night. Martin

Reviews.Title: “Close to Paddington Station”
Reviews.Author: RennmausHamburg
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I expected something better. Since we were in London for the sights and not to spend time at the hotel, it was ok for that purpose only. They put us in what I think was their last available room. Totally in the basement and VERY small. Small window with a view looking up to the street. Nothing like the pictures we saw on the internet. Clean sheets were folded on the bed and we ended up making the beds ourselves. But as mentioned, the location is perfect if you fly into London Heathrow Airport. Train to Paddington, 7 minute walk and you are at the hotel. For that reason only, I would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Brunel Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 79-81 Gloucester Terrace | Bayswater, London W2 3HB, England
